DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective is to evaluate whether Zoladex 10.8 mg (12-weekly) is non-inferior to Zoladex 3.6 mg (4-weekly) in pre-menopausal women with oestrogen receptor positive advanced breast cancer by assessment of progression-free survival at 24 weeks. Secondary Objectives are to compare the safety and tolerability profile of ZOLADEX 10.8 mg and ZOLADEX 3.6 mg by assessment of adverse events (AEs)and to assess goserelin PK in Japanese and Caucasian participants who have received ZOLADEX 10.8 mg by assessment of goserelin plasma concentration time profiles Recruitment into the study has been permanently stopped as of 24 December 2007 due to slow recruitment. 98 (vs the planned 260) patients were randomised into the study and will be followed as per protocol for 2 years
DOC.brief_title: Study of Zoladex Given Every 12 Weeks Versus Given Every Month in Advanced Breast Cancer (ABC) Pre-menopausal Women
DOC.criteria: Premenopausal women aged 18 years or over with histologically/cytologicallyconfirmed oestrogen receptor positive (ER +ve) breast cancer World Health Organization (WHO) performance status of 0, 1, or 2 Provided written informed consent Treatment with tamoxifen or other hormonal therapies as early breast cancer (EBC) adjuvant in the previous 24 weeks Received radiotherapy within the past 4 weeks History of systemic malignancy other than breast cancer within the previous 3 years Estimated survival less than 24 weeks
